instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
this board not green light, not turn on fan;
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.26
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>=3.44
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>=0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
At least <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> comes high?
<RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is good?

Y5010 gets oscillations?
Check its DC voltage, if no o-scope available.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS=0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=0V
<RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is good
Y5010 gets oscillations? not
Check its DC voltage. there is no voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message:
Seems to have SMC issue.
Check signals and voltage for <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2), page 45.

You may need to reball/change SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b
threads.message: this board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b is proccesor 2.9 ghz core i7, I have a board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> b 2.5 proccesor 2.5 ghz.The board 2.5 smc works well for the 2.9 board?
